definitions: a many-headed serpent in Greek mythology slain by Hercules
a persistent or multifaceted problem perceived as difficult to solve
a small freshwater animal of the phylum Cnidaria with a tubular body and tentacles
examples: Slaying the hydra was one of Hercules' labors.
The company's debt was like a hydra, ever-growing.
The hydra regenerated its tentacles quickly.
